page.title: 01Gazetteer Rayleigh
page.content: The Rayleigh survey grid covers a pre- dominately surburban area close to and adjoining Southend but also within commuting distance of London.Historic- ally the town can prove architectural remains which show settlement in Norman times (Rayleigh Mount) but the real impetus to growth came in the late 19th century with the opening of the railway line linking Southend Victoria with London Liverpool Street since when Rayleigh has grown to have a population of 27,000.Modern lines of communication place the town not only on the now electrified rail line but also on the dual carriageway A127 London Southend trunk route which puts Rayleigh only 16 miles away from the M25 motorway. Chelmsford,Canvey and Basildon are also important sources of local employment and commerce.
